official-title.#text: To impose sanctions against persons who knowingly provide material support or resources to the Donbass People’s Militia or its affiliates, associated groups, or agents, and for other purposes.

cosponsor.#text: Mrs. Carolyn B. Maloney of New York

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Donbass People’s Militia Terrorist Designation Act of 2014
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Donbass People’s Militia Terrorist Designation Act of 2014

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text: Sense of Congress on designation of the Donbass People’s Militia as a foreign terrorist organization

text.#text: Congress finds the following:
The Donbass People’s Militia (DPM) is an armed militia with allegiance to the Donestsk People’s Republic, a self-proclaimed State in Eastern Europe.
The organization consists of pro-Russian separatists that have taken up arms against the Ukrainian Armed Forces and the Government of Ukraine.
The Government of Ukraine has concluded that the DPM is responsible for shooting down Malaysian Airlines Flight 17 on July 17, 2014.
The actions of the DPM resulted in the deaths of 283 passengers, 80 of them children, and 15 crew members.
A

quote.#text: in eastern Ukraine, freedom of expression is under particular attack through the harassment of, and threats to, journalists and media outlets and the increasing prevalence of hate speech is further fuelling tensions (Section I, Article 5, Section vi).

text.#text: According to the

quote.#text: Armed groups continue to illegally seize and occupy public and administrative buildings in cities and towns of the eastern regions and proclaim

text.#text: Leaders and members of these armed groups commit an increasing number of human rights abuses, such as abductions, harassment, unlawful detentions, in particularly of journalists. This is leading to a breakdown in law and order and a climate of intimidation and harassment (Section I, Article 5, Section ii).

quote.#text: Anti-Kiev forces in eastern Ukraine are abducting, attacking, and harassing people they suspect of supporting the Ukrainian government or consider undesirable.

text.#text: A report by the highly respected human rights advocacy organization, Human Rights Watch, found that
Militants in the self-proclaimed Donestsk People’s Republic have taken hostages and have yet to release them.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: High Commissioner for Refugees, the actions of DPM and other militant groups have caused over 100,000 Ukrainians to flee their country as refugees and have also displaced approximately 54,000 citizens internally.

text.#text: According to a report by the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: provides the 3 criteria for the designation of an organization as a foreign terrorist organization:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Section 219(a)(1) of the Immigration and Nationality Act

text.#text: The organization must be a foreign organization.
The organization must engage in terrorist activity, as defined in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: section 212(a)(3)(B) of the Immigration and Nationality Act

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , or retain the capability and intent to engage in terrorist activity or terrorism.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: section 140(d)(2) of the Foreign Relations Authorization Act, Fiscal Years 1988 and 1989
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Foreign Relations Authorization Act, Fiscal Years 1988 and 1989/s:140/ss:d/p:2

text.#text: The organization’s terrorist activity or terrorism must threaten the security of United States nationals or the national security (national defense, foreign relations, or the economic interests) of the United States.
It is the sense of

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: section 219 of the Immigration and Nationality Act

text.#text: the Donbass People’s Militia has met the criteria for designation as a foreign terrorist organization under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: ’s statutory authority and designate the Donbass People’s Militia as a foreign terrorist organization.

text.#text: If the

header.#text: Sanctions against persons who knowingly provide material support or resources to the Donbass People’s Militia or its affiliates, associated groups, or agents

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall subject to all available sanctions any person in the United States or subject to the jurisdiction of the United States who knowingly provides material support or resources to the Donbass People’s Militia or its affiliates, associated groups, or agents.
